snippet: It was unclear whether the changes marked the start of a shift toward better news on the economics of higher education or just a temporary pause in more worrisome trends.
abstract: Three studies, including those by Institute for College Access and Success and College Board, find real costs of college and student borrowing have leveled off, after years of sharp increases in college prices and student debt; it is unclear whether changes mark start of shift toward easing of price increases or just temporary pause.
lead_paragraph: It was unclear whether the changes marked the start of a shift toward better news on the economics of higher education or just a temporary pause in more worrisome trends.

headline.main: Financial Pressures Ease on Students, Studies Say
headline.print_headline: Financial Pressures Ease on Students, Studies Say

keywords.value: Institute for College Access and Success
keywords.name: organizations
